name: potassium chloride production, from salar brine | potassium chloride, industrial grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20457/documentation

This activity represents the production of potassium chloride from salar brine in Chile. The Atacama Desert in northern Chile is rich in Salar brines which are formed through a natural leaching process in underground halite aquifers where increasing concentrations of lithium and potassium from the Andes Mountains are accumulated.

The activity starts with the pumping of Salar brines via standard wells from approximately 0.5 – 30 m below a salt crust into large evaporation ponds (plastic-lined) to concentrate the salts. This site in the Atacama Desert is best suited for solar drying (8 – 10 months) since it offers very dry atmospheric conditions. The initial phase chemistry is controlled by mixing brines from separate evaporation ponds to remove the magnesium and sulfate at the early stages of the evaporation.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the salts rich in potassium chloride by excavators ready for use at a purity of min. 95%. Other chemical components are sodium (typical 0.9), sulfate (2.0) magnesium (<0.1), calcium (<0.8), insolubles (<0.1) and moisture (0.3).
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Process data provided are from 2014/2015 and are valid for today's and near future production at SQM in Chile.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The production facilitiy is located in the Atacama Desert in northern Chile where the chemical is produced from natural resources by the global producer and supplier SQM.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data have been provided by the producer SQM in Chile.  SQM is a global producer and supplier of plant nutrients, iodine, lithium and industrial chemicals. The production facilities are located in the Atacama Desert where the chemicals are produced from natural resources via mining, crystalization and refining processes. Initially, some data and process information has been exchanged via questionaires. Further, more specific data were provided via intensive direct contact with experts at SQM.

exchanges.description: Natural ressource in the Atacama Dessert in Chile found in underground aquifers. 0.027m3 is required to produce 1kg of potassium chloride, 95% purity. The brine density is estimated to be 1200 kg/m3.

Salar bine is pumped from undertround aquifers into large evaporation ponds.  This site in the Atacama Desert is best suited for solar drying (8 – 10 months) since it offers very dry atmospheric conditions all year around.
Fuel used in machines to harvest the salts
